code:
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

yesterday = datetime.now() - timedelta(days=1)
yesterday.strftime('%m%d%y')

>>> from datetime import date, timedelta
>>> yesterday = date.today() - timedelta(1)
>>> print yesterday.strftime('%m%d%y')
'110909'

text: This should do what you want:

code:
import datetime
yesterday = datetime.datetime.now() - datetime.timedelta(days = 1)
print yesterday.strftime("%m%d%y")

import datetime
now = datetime.datetime.now()
now -= datetime.timedelta(days=1)
print now.strftime("%m%d%y")

text: You can find all the string format codes here: http://au2.php.net/strftime

code:
In [1]: import datetime

In [2]: today=datetime.date.today()

In [3]: yesterday=today-datetime.timedelta(1)

In [4]: yesterday.strftime('%m%d%y')
Out[4]: '110909'

text: Stolen from the python mailing list.

code:
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

today = datetime.today()
yesterday = today - timedelta(1)

from datetime import datetime, timedelta

yesterday = (date.today() - timedelta(days=1)).strftime('%m%d%y')
